We all wish we had vacations throughout the summer so we could camp in that one room that is air-condition (Read More)ed at home, and no amount of fanning ourselves will save us from the sticky feeling we come home with after a day in the local. Exactly the reason why weekends are more looked forward to during the summers, and why we must Holidify at the first chance, we get to escape the nauseating noise and the ever- troubling sweaty feeling. Here is the list of 15 Places To Visit Near Mumbai In Summer 1. Lonavala, Maharashtra 4.4 /5 View 38+ photos Known For : Tiger's Leap Rajmachi Fort Imagicaa Lonavala, a popular hill station near Mumbai, is a perfect summer retreat known for its cool climate and lush greenery. Located about 83 km from Mumbai, it offers scenic views, waterfalls, and misty hills, making it an ideal escape from the city's heat. Attractions like Tiger’s Leap, Bhushi Dam, Rajmachi Fort, and Karla Caves add to its charm. The town is also famous for its chikki (a local sweet) and monsoon treks. With its refreshing ambiance, Lonavala is a great destination for nature lovers and adventure seekers alike. Distance from Mumbai: 83 km Best Time: Throughout the year 41 Lonavala Attractions View Hotels Read More 2. Matheran, Maharashtra 4.1 /5 View 26+ photos Known For : Louisa point Charlotte lake Monkey Point Matheran Matheran, a charming hill station near Mumbai, is an ideal summer retreat known for its cool climate and lush greenery. It is Asia’s only automobile-free hill station, offering a peaceful escape from city life. Visitors can enjoy scenic viewpoints like Louisa Point, Panorama Point, and Echo Point, along with horse riding and toy train rides. The pleasant weather and misty landscapes make it perfect for trekking and nature walks. Matheran’s colonial-era charm and serene atmosphere make it a top summer getaway near Mumbai. Distance: 83 kms via the Sion-Panvel Expressway Best Time: Throughout the year 29 Matheran Attractions View Hotels Read More 3. Khandala, Maharashtra 4.6 /5 View 22+ photos Known For : Rajmachi Fort Visapur Fort Bedsa caves Khandala, a picturesque hill station near Mumbai, is a perfect summer getaway known for its cool climate and scenic beauty. Located about 80 km from Mumbai, it offers breathtaking views of the Sahyadri Hills, lush valleys, and waterfalls. Popular attractions include Tiger’s Leap, Duke’s Nose, and Bhushi Dam, ideal for nature lovers and adventure seekers. The misty hills and pleasant weather make it a great spot for trekking, photography, and relaxation. Easily accessible via Mumbai-Pune Expressway, Khandala is a must-visit destination during the summer. Distance from Mumbai: 79 km Best Time: Throughout the year 22 Khandala Attractions View Hotels Read More 4. Kamshet, Maharashtra 4.4 /5 View 9+ photos Known For : Paragliding Shinde Wadi hills Pawna Lake Kamshet, also known as the ‘Paraglider’s Paradise,’ is located 19 km from the twin hill stations of Khandala and Lonavala. A smile automatically reaches for your face when you see the little mud huts with thatched roofs, good old natural goodness, and rivers at arm’s length right outside the Kamshet railway station. Away from the city, relaxed as to not see any more concrete. Go trekking in the nearby areas of Lohagad, Karla caves or Ryewood park, and make sure you experience paragliding over the beautiful hills and the sunflower fields. Distance from Mumbai: 99 km Best Time: October to June 7 Kamshet Attractions View Hotels Read More Top Hotels In Mumbai Search Hotels Taj Hotels In Mumbai 6 options from ₹ 11,500 onwards Mumbai Hotels Near Airport 50 options from ₹ 898 onwards Best 5 Star Hotels in Mumbai 39 options from ₹ 6,228 onwards Best Resorts Near Mumbai For An Urban Getaway 26 options from ₹ 3,300 onwards Hotels In Bandra, Mumbai 50 options from ₹ 1,000 onwards Best Hotels in Mumbai 47 options from ₹ 3,750 onwards View All Hotels In Mumbai View All Hotels In Mumbai 5. Malshej Ghat, Maharashtra 4.8 /5 View 14+ photos Known For : Malshej Falls Pimpalgaon Joga Dam Harishchandragad Malshej Ghat, a stunning mountain pass in the Sahyadri Hills, is an ideal summer retreat near Mumbai, located about 130 km away. Known for its misty hills, waterfalls, and lush greenery, it offers breathtaking views and a refreshing escape from the heat. Popular attractions include Harishchandragad Fort, Pimpalgaon Joga Dam, and Shivneri Fort. Adventure lovers can enjoy trekking, birdwatching, and nature walks, especially spotting migratory flamingos near the dam. With its serene ambiance and cool climate, Malshej Ghat is a perfect destination for a summer getaway. Distance from Mumbai: 130 km Best Time: July to March 4 Malshej Ghat Attractions View Hotels Read More 6. Bhandardara, Maharashtra 4.8 /5 View 11+ photos Known For : Umbrella Falls Wilson Dam Kalsubai Peak Bhandardara, a tranquil hill station about 165 km from Mumbai, is a perfect summer retreat known for its lakes, waterfalls, and lush greenery. The serene Arthur Lake and the breathtaking Randha Falls make it a paradise for nature lovers. Adventure seekers can trek to Ratangad Fort and Kalsubai Peak, the highest peak in Maharashtra. The Wilson Dam, built over the Pravara River, adds to the charm with its scenic surroundings. With its cool climate and picturesque landscapes, Bhandardara is an ideal escape from Mumbai’s summer heat. Distance from Mumbai: 166 km Best Time: June to March 7 Bhandardara Attractions View Hotels Read More 7. Lavasa, Maharashtra 4.7 /5 View 5+ photos Known For : Sightseeing in Lavasa Lakeside Promenade Bamboosa Lavasa, a planned hill city near Pune, about 190 km from Mumbai, is a scenic summer getaway known for its European-style architecture and waterfront views. Surrounded by the Sahyadri Hills, it offers a peaceful retreat with activities like boating, cycling, and nature walks along the serene Warasgaon Lake. Adventure enthusiasts can enjoy trekking, water sports, and zip-lining, while cafes and promenades provide a relaxing ambiance. The pleasant weather and picturesque landscapes make Lavasa a great summer escape near Mumbai. Distance from Mumbai: 187 km Best Time: Throughout the year 5 Lavasa Attractions View Hotels Read More 8. Panchgani, Maharashtra 4.6 /5 View 16+ photos Known For : Kaas Plateau Table Land Mahabaleshwar Panchgani, a charming hill station about 250 km from Mumbai, is a perfect summer retreat known for its cool climate, lush greenery, and colonial charm. Surrounded by five hills of the Sahyadri range, it offers breathtaking views from spots like Table Land, Sydney Point, and Parsi Point. Visitors can enjoy trekking, horse riding, and strawberry farms, making it a great destination for nature lovers and families. The nearby Dhom Dam and Devil’s Kitchen Caves add to its appeal. With its misty hills and scenic beauty, Panchgani is an ideal getaway from Mumbai’s summer heat. Distance from Mumbai: 244 km Best Time: September to May 13 Panchgani Attractions View Hotels Read More 9. Saputara, Gujarat 4.5 /5 View 7+ photos Known For : Nageshwar Mahadev Temple Saputara Lake Artist Village Saputara, Gujarat’s only hill station, is a refreshing summer retreat located about 250 km from Mumbai in the Sahyadri Hills. Known for its cool climate, lush forests, and serene lakes, it offers stunning views from Sunset Point and Governor’s Hill. Visitors can enjoy boating at Saputara Lake, exploring Artist Village, or trekking to Hatgad Fort. The Gira Waterfalls and Saputara Tribal Museum add to the charm of this peaceful destination. With its scenic beauty and pleasant weather, Saputara is an ideal summer getaway near Mumbai. Distance from Mumbai: 244 km Best Time: Mid March to mid November 21 Saputara Attractions View Hotels Read More 10. Amboli, Maharashtra 4.6 /5 View 6+ photos Known For : Amboli Falls Madhavgad Fort Shirgaonkar Point Amboli, a serene hill station in Maharashtra’s Sindhudurg district, is a perfect summer escape located about 500 km from Mumbai. Nestled in the Western Ghats, it is known for its lush greenery, misty valleys, and stunning waterfalls. Popular attractions include Amboli Waterfalls, Madhavgad Fort, and Shirgaonkar Point, offering breathtaking views. Nature lovers can explore endangered flora and fauna in the Amboli forests, while adventure seekers can enjoy trekking and birdwatching. With its cool climate and tranquil ambiance, Amboli is an ideal summer retreat near Mumbai. Distance from Mumbai: 489 km Best Time: June to September 6 Amboli Attractions View Hotels Read More 11. Tarkarli, Maharashtra 4.1 /5 View 17+ photos Known For : Water sports Tarkarli Beach Karli backwaters Tarkarli, a coastal paradise in Sindhudurg district, is a perfect summer getaway located about 530 km from Mumbai. Known for its pristine beaches, clear blue waters, and thrilling water sports, it is one of Maharashtra’s best beach destinations. Visitors can enjoy scuba diving, snorkeling, and parasailing, exploring the vibrant marine life. The historic Sindhudurg Fort, built by Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj, adds a cultural touch to the trip. With its serene ambiance and adventure-filled activities, Tarkarli is an ideal summer escape near Mumbai. Distance from Mumbai: 528 km Best Time: October to March 20 Tarkarli Attractions View Hotels Read More 12. Palghar 4.7 /5 Palghar, a coastal town about 110 km from Mumbai, is a great summer getaway known for its beaches, forts, and scenic countryside. Popular attractions include Kelva Beach and Shirgaon Beach, perfect for a relaxing seaside escape. History lovers can explore Shirgaon Fort and Kelva Fort, which offer stunning views of the Arabian Sea. The region is also known for its Warli art and local seafood delicacies. With its mix of nature, history, and coastal charm, Palghar is an ideal short trip from Mumbai in summer. Distance from Mumbai: 97 km Best Time: October to March View Hotels Read More 13. Igatpuri, Maharashtra 4.2 /5 Known For : Tringalwadi Fort Vihigaon Waterfall Kalsubai Peak Igatpuri, a scenic hill station in the Western Ghats, is an ideal summer retreat located about 120 km from Mumbai. Known for its lush greenery, misty mountains, and ancient forts, it offers a refreshing escape from the city's heat. Popular attractions include Bhatsa River Valley, Camel Valley, Tringalwadi Fort, and Vaitarna Dam. Adventure seekers can enjoy trekking, camping, and visiting the famous Vipassana Meditation Center. With its cool climate and breathtaking landscapes, Igatpuri is a perfect summer getaway near Mumbai. Distance from Mumbai: 120 km Best Time: July to September 14 Igatpuri Attractions View Hotels Read More 14. Jawhar, Maharashtra 4.7 /5 View 23+ photos Known For : Dabdaba Falls Jai Vilas Palace Sunset Point, Jawhar Jawhar, a hidden gem in Palghar district, is a serene hill station located about 140 km from Mumbai. Known for its lush greenery, waterfalls, and Warli art, it offers a peaceful escape from the summer heat. Key attractions include Jai Vilas Palace, Dabdaba Falls, Hanuman Point, and Sunset Point, perfect for nature lovers and photographers. Visitors can also explore the rich tribal heritage and Warli paintings, which reflect the region’s cultural essence. With its cool climate and scenic beauty, Jawhar is an ideal offbeat summer getaway near Mumbai. Distance from Mumbai: 136 km Best Time: September to Apr 7 Jawhar Attractions View Hotels Read More 15. Mahabaleshwar, Maharashtra 4.1 /5 View 20+ photos Known For : Elephant's Head Point Chinaman's Falls Dhobi Waterfall Mahabaleshwar, one of Maharashtra’s most popular hill stations, is a perfect summer retreat located about 260 km from Mumbai. Nestled in the Sahyadri Hills, it is known for its lush greenery, breathtaking viewpoints, and strawberry farms. Must-visit attractions include Arthur’s Seat, Elephant’s Head Point, Venna Lake, and Pratapgad Fort. Visitors can enjoy boating, trekking, and tasting fresh strawberries at the famous Mapro Garden. With its cool climate and scenic landscapes, Mahabaleshwar is an ideal escape from Mumbai’s summer heat. Distance from Mumbai: 231 km Best Time: October to June 31 Mahabaleshwar Attractions View Hotels Read More The City of Mumbai is one of the most lovable cities and a great tourist attraction.
